intro: Penstemon virgatus subsp. arizonicus, commonly known as Arizona beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
